workflow.name: RSS to social: automated content generation with Llama 3 & GetLate Publishing
workflow.description:
üöÄ **Automate your social media presence!** This workflow duo automatically curates content from your Wallabag RSS feeds, generates platform-specific posts using AI, and publishes them‚Äîcomplete with AI-generated images.

### **‚öôÔ∏è Setup & Configuration**

**Required Credentials & Services:**
To run this workflow, you will need to set up the following credentials in n8n:
*   **Wallabag RSS Feeds:** This workflow uses Wallabag as your content curation service. Wallabag is the most cost-effective option‚Äîeasy to self-host or use as a paid service. You'll need to generate access tokens for RSS feed access.
*   **Airtable API Key:** To create and update records in your "Content Store" database.
*   **LLM Provider API Key:** To power the social media content generation. The demo uses **Groq (llama-3.3-70b-versatile)**, but this can be replaced with any preferred LLM (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.).
*   **GetLate API Key:** To authenticate and post to your social media platforms.
*   **Imgbb API Key:** To host the AI-generated images.
*   **An Image Generation Service API Key:** For creating images from prompts. The demo uses **Hugging Face (stable-diffusion-xl-base-1.0)**, but this can be swapped for any other service (Fal.ai, Stability AI, etc.).

**Key Setup Requirement: Define Your Tagging Convention**
Before running this workflow, establish a consistent tagging system in Wallabag where each tag corresponds to a specific social media platform. For example:
* `#to-share-linkedin` for LinkedIn content
* `#to-share-bluesky` for Bluesky content
* `#to-share-instagram` for Instagram content

**Adding More Feeds & Platforms:**
* **New Feeds:** Simply duplicate the example sub-workflows and update the RSS feed URL and target platform information for each new tag/platform combination.
* **New Platforms:** To add support for additional social platforms, duplicate one of the existing platform sub-workflows (LinkedIn or Bluesky) and update the platform-specific parameters, prompts, and GetLate API settings for your new platform.

**Airtable Database Schema: "RSS Feed - Content Store"**
The workflow uses an Airtable base with the following fields to track content from ingestion to publication:
*   `id` (Primary Field):  Formula, for unique record ID (`RECORD_ID()`)
*   `audience_targeted`: Long text
*   `author`: Long text
*   `character_count`: Number
*   `content_markdown`: Long text
*   `cta_used`: Long text
*   `feed_id`: Single line text
*   `goal_applied`: Long text
*   `image_filename`: Singe line text
*   `image_id`: Single line text
*   `image_link`: URL
*   `image_prompt`: Long text
*   `is_posted`: Number, default is 0
*   `platform`: Single line text
*   `post_text`: Long text
*   `suggested_hashtags`: Long text
*   `title`: Long text
*   `tone_applied`: Long text
*   `article_url`: URL

**Customizable User Inputs:**
This workflow is built for flexibility. Key inputs you can customize include:
*   **Wallabag RSS Feed URL & Platform Tag:** The specific feed and platform-specific tag (e.g., `#to-share-linkedin`) to monitor in Workflow #1.
*   **Target Social Platform:** Defined per feed in the "Edit Field" node.
*   **Content Generation Schedule:** The frequency for auto-posting in the Schedule Trigger.
*   **Brand Voice & LLM Parameters:** The tone, style, and specific instructions for the AI in the "Set Custom SMCG Prompt" node.
*   **Platform-Specific Prompts:** The template used to generate posts for each social network (Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.).
*   **Posting Behavior & Image Generation:** Configured within the **SMCG (Social Media Content Generation) node**. This is where you set the posting mode (immediate vs. draft) and define a boolean for each platform to enable or disable AI-generated images for its posts.

### **üì• Workflow 1: RSS Aggregator & Content Store**

- **RSS Trigger** ‚Üí Pulls tagged articles from Wallabag feeds using platform-specific tags
- **Platform Assignment** ‚Üí Sets target social platform based on tag
- **Content Conversion** ‚Üí HTML to Markdown formatting
- **Airtable Storage** ‚Üí Saves articles to content database

**üåü Adding New RSS Feeds:** To monitor additional Wallabag feeds for different content sources, simply duplicate the existing RSS feed sub-workflow and update the RSS URL with your new Wallabag access token and platform-specific tag. Each feed can target a different social platform or content category.

### **üîÑ Workflow 2: AI Content Generator & Publisher**

- **Schedule Trigger** ‚Üí Runs on your preferred frequency
- **Content Selection** ‚Üí Pulls unpublished articles from Airtable
- **AI Configuration** ‚Üí Sets brand voice, posting behavior, and image generation preferences
- **Platform Routing** ‚Üí Directs to appropriate social platform workflow
- **AI Content Generation** ‚Üí Creates posts and image prompts using LLM
- **Image Generation** ‚Üí Creates & hosts images when enabled
- **Social Publishing** ‚Üí Posts to platforms via GetLate API
- **Database Update** ‚Üí Marks content as published in Airtable

**üåü Adding New Platform Support:** To extend this workflow to additional social platforms, simply duplicate one of the existing platform sub-workflows and update the platform-specific parameters, LLM prompts, and GetLate API configuration for your target platform.

workflow.name: ü§ñ Automated Social Media Content Engine: From RSS to Published Post

assignments.name: chatInput
assignments.value:
=Role: You are a professional social media content generator specializing in Bluesky.

Task: Create one optimized Bluesky post (skeet) based on the provided article content and user specifications.

Input Data:
- Niche: {{ $json.niche }}
- Tone: {{ $json.tone }}
- Goal: {{ $json.goal }}
- Target Audience: {{ $json.target_audience }}
- Custom Tags: {{ $json.custom_tags }}
- Needs Image Prompt: {{ $json.generate_image_bluesky }}
- Article Title: {{ $('Pull New Article').item.json.title }}
- Article Author: {{ $('Pull New Article').item.json.author }}
- Article Content: {{ $('Pull New Article').item.json.content_markdown }}

Content Creation Guidelines:

1. Bluesky Post Structure:
   - Create concise, engaging content suitable for a broad, real-time audience
   - Length: Optimal 250-300 characters, maximum 300 characters
   - First line should contain a strong, engaging hook to stop the scroll
   - Use 1-2 short paragraphs with line breaks for readability
   - Focus on one key insight or a compelling question
   - Include 2-3 relevant hashtags within the post text itself, placed naturally within the content
   - PRIORITIZE and INCLUDE all custom hashtags and mentions from the user's "custom_tags" input within the post text

2. Content Quality:
   - Extract the most valuable or surprising insight from the article
   - Use language matching the specified tone (can be more casual than LinkedIn)
   - Include a clear call-to-action aligned with the goal (e.g., "Read the full article," "What's your take?")
   - Encourage engagement through questions or provocative statements
   - Add unique perspective or context beyond a simple summary
   - Integrate hashtags and mentions organically into the post text rather than appending them at the end
   - Ensure all custom tags (hashtags and @mentions) provided by the user are naturally incorporated into the post content

3. Image Prompt Handling:
   - If "needs_image_prompt" is true: Generate a descriptive image prompt that visually represents the article's core concept in a style suitable for Bluesky's diverse user base
   - If "needs_image_prompt" is false: Set image_prompt to null
   - Image prompts should be clear, descriptive, and suitable for general image generation

Output Requirements:
- Return ONLY a valid JSON object with no additional text.
- Use the exact keys and types specified below:
  - "platform": string (always "Bluesky")
  - "post_text": string (250-300 characters, with engaging hook and integrated hashtags/mentions)
  - "suggested_hashtags": array of strings (2-3 relevant hashtags that are included in the post text, prioritizing custom tags)
  - "cta_used": string (clear, concise call-to-action)
  - "tone_applied": string (from input)
  - "goal_applied": string (from input)
  - "audience_targeted": string (from input)
  - "character_count": integer (accurate count of post_text)
  - "image_prompt": string or empty (descriptive if needed)

JSON Output Structure:

{
  "platform": "Bluesky",
  "post_text": "Full generated post text here with #hashtags and @mentions integrated naturally into the content, prioritizing user's custom tags",
  "suggested_hashtags": ["#customtag1", "#customtag2", "#relevant"],
  "cta_used": "Specific call-to-action phrase used",
  "tone_applied": "{{ $json.tone }}",
  "goal_applied": "{{ $json.goal }}",
  "audience_targeted": "{{ $json.target_audience }}",
  "character_count": 285,
  "image_prompt": "Descriptive image prompt or 'null'",
}

base.cachedResultName: RSS Feed Store - Wallabag RSS Feed Aggregator

assignments.name: chatInput
assignments.value:
=Role: You are a professional social media content generator specializing in LinkedIn.

Task: Create one optimized LinkedIn post based on the provided article content and user specifications.

Input Data:
- Niche: {{ $json.niche }}
- Tone:{{ $json.tone }}
- Goal: {{ $json.goal }}
- Target Audience: {{ $json.target_audience }}
- Custom Tags: {{ $json.custom_tags }}
- Needs Image Prompt: {{ $json.generate_image_linkedin }}
- Article Title: {{ $('Pull New Article').item.json.title }}
- Article Author: {{ $('Pull New Article').item.json.author }}
- Article Content: {{ $('Pull New Article').item.json.content_markdown }}

Content Creation Guidelines:

1. LinkedIn Post Structure:
   - Create professional content suitable for business audiences
   - Length: 1,500-2,000 characters optimal, maximum 3,000 characters
   - First 140 characters should contain an engaging hook
   - Use 2-3 paragraphs with line breaks for readability
   - Include 3-5 relevant hashtags at the end

2. Content Quality:
   - Focus on valuable insights from the article
   - Use professional language matching the specified tone
   - Include a clear call-to-action aligned with the goal
   - Pose questions to encourage engagement
   - Add context or perspective beyond simple article summary

3. Image Prompt Handling:
   - If "needs_image_prompt" is true: Generate a descriptive image prompt that visually represents the article's core concept in a professional style
   - If "needs_image_prompt" is false: Set image_prompt to null
   - Image prompts should be clear, descriptive, and suitable for general image generation

Output Requirements:
- Return ONLY a valid JSON object with no additional text.
- Use the exact keys and types specified below:
  - "platform": string (always "LinkedIn")
  - "post_text": string (1500-3000 characters, with engaging hook)
  - "suggested_hashtags": array of strings (3-5 hashtags, including #n8n and #automation)
  - "cta_used": string (clear call-to-action)
  - "tone_applied": string (from input)
  - "goal_applied": string (from input)
  - "audience_targeted": string (from input)
  - "character_count": integer (accurate count of post_text)
  - "image_prompt": string or null (descriptive if needed)

JSON Output Structure:

{
  "platform": "LinkedIn",
  "post_text": "Full generated post text here",
  "suggested_hashtags": ["#tag1", "#tag2", "#tag3"],
  "cta_used": "Specific call-to-action phrase used",
  "tone_applied": "{{ $json.tone }}",
  "goal_applied": "{{ $json.goal }}",
  "audience_targeted": "{{ $json.target_audience }}",
  "character_count": 1850,
  "image_prompt": "Descriptive image prompt or null",
}

parameters.content:
# ‚öôÔ∏è**Required Credentials & Services Setup**

### üîë **API Credentials Needed:**

To run this workflow, configure the following credentials in your n8n instance:

* **Wallabag Access Token & RSS Feed URLs**
  - https://wallabag.it/en/
  - Required as the content source for this workflow
  - Generate an access token in Wallabag to access RSS feed URLs
  - Use RSS feed links for tags marked for social sharing in format:
      - https://your-wallabag-instance.com/feed/wallabag/your-access-token/tags/t:your-article-tag

* **Airtable API Key**
  - https://airtable.com/create/tokens

* **LLM Provider API Key** 
  - This demo is configured for **Groq**, but is compatible with OpenAI, Anthropic, or other providers.
  - https://console.groq.com/keys

* **GetLate API Key**
  - https://getlate.dev/dashboard/api-keys

* **Imgbb API Key**
  - https://api.imgbb.com/

* **Image Generation Service API Key**
  - This demo uses **Hugging Face**, but is interchangeable with Fal.ai, Stability AI, or similar services
  - https://huggingface.co/settings/tokens


### **Setup Notes:**
  - All credentials should be added to n8n's credentials management before workflow execution
  - Ensure proper permission scopes for each API key
  - Test individual API connections before running full workflow
  - Consider rate limits and billing for each service

# Step 1Ô∏è‚É£: RSS Aggregator & Content Store
This creates a centralized content repository ready for social media transformation, ensuring you always have fresh material to share with your audience.

# Step 2Ô∏è‚É£: AI Content Generation & Publishing
This workflow transforms stored articles into ready-to-publish social media content. Operating on a scheduled basis, it pulls unpublished articles from the database and uses AI to generate platform-optimized posts complete with captions, hashtags, and image prompts.
## ‚öôÔ∏è Configure Imgbb & Image Generation Service Credentials
## ‚öôÔ∏è Set AI Content Generator Parameters & Other Settings
## ‚öôÔ∏è Configure Feed Credentials & Social Media Platform

# ‚öôÔ∏è Posting Schedule Configuration

The workflow's **Schedule Trigger** lets you control how often content is automatically published or drafted. You can set your preferred frequency (hourly, daily, weekly, etc.) and the system will:
   

   - Pull fresh articles from your content database
   - Generate platform-optimized posts using AI 
   - Auto-publish or save as drafts based on your settings


This creates a consistent content cadence without manual intervention, keeping your social channels active with minimal effort.

# ‚öôÔ∏è Custom AI Generator Parameters & Other Settings

üé® **Niche:** The creator's niche market, audience, etc. 

üí¨ **Tone:** What tone should the post have? (e.g. Professional & polished, friendly & conversational, urgent & punchy ...)

üéØ **Goal:** What‚Äôs the primary goal of your social post? (e.g. Drive traffic to the article, spark discussion or debate, build brand authority...)

üë• **Target Audience:** Who is your target audience? (e.g. Industry professionals, general public, students or academics ... )

‚úçÔ∏è **Custom Hashtags & Mentions:** Any specific keywords, hashtags, or handles to include? (e.g. # DigitalMarketing, @n8n, #automation)

üõú **Is Draft?:** Set the posting mode to be immediate (false) or draft (true).

üñºÔ∏è **Generate Image Prompt**: Enable (true) or disable (false) AI-generated images for posts per platform. 

ü™™**Platform Account ID**: Set the GetLate Account ID for each platform generated content will be posted to.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
